page.title: 06Shopping in Brightwell
page.content: {The Post Office} in Brightwell is owned by Tom and Anne Brown. The shop is about years old. Apart from a full Post service which is of great benefit to all villagers they also run a General Store and sell things like sweets, frozen food and fresh goods. Since the bakery closed a few months ago they now sell fresh bread which costs from 30p a loaf. They also sell wines. {Lynch's Shop} Mr Lynch has owned the village shop for 30 years.The shop was built in 1803. Today it sells fresh meat, fruit, vegetables, sweets, and other foods. They also sell news papers and employ young people over 13 years to deliver them. The local weekly Newspaper is called The Wallingford Herald and costs 17p. Milk cots 22p a pint, crisps cost 13p and breakfast cereals 70p a pack.
